column13: Management Essentials is a program for managers and senior managers across all business areas. Topics include the role of a leader, building trust, communication and feedback, coaching, change and inclusive leadership with a focus on the individual biases that affect relationships, collaboration and performance.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: The CSL Executive Edge program accelerates the development of high-potential senior leaders to help prepare them for executive roles. The program focuses on leading strategy and people with an enterprise and inclusive mindset. It offers an immersive in-market experience, executive exposure and networking, and engagement in a strategic project tied to the company's strategy.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Leadership Excellence is a program specially designed for associate directors and directors across all areas of our business. It also includes business simulations, peer learning activities and reverse mentoring to broaden participant perspectives.

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column7: In alignment with ASX Corporate Governance Council Principles, we have established measurable long-term gender goals: 30% or better of each gender represented on our Board of Directors, 50% women among our People Manager population by 2025 and 40% women among our Senior Executives by 2030.

column7: CSL recognises that we are responsible for respecting the rights of all individuals we interact with, including our patients, clinical trial participants, plasma donors, healthcare professionals, and employees. CSL complies with the minimum age labour requirements in every country we operate.

column7: From 1 July 2022 to 30 June 2023, no reports related to human trafficking or slavery and forced labour in CSL's global operations were received.

column7: Where CSL is working with other third parties and manufacturers of products and services that form part of our total supply chain, CSL expects their policies and practices to respect these rights similarly. CSL will partner with stakeholders, including industry associations and government and non-government organisations (NGOs), where practical and of mutual benefit, to continually improve its suppliers' and partners' human rights practices.

column6: Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column7: CSL's researchers and employees are dedicated to conducting our clinical trials by consensus ethical principles derived from international ethics guidelines, such as the International Council for Harmonisation (ICH). Guideline for Good Clinical Practice (GCP), the World Medical Association Declaration of Helsinki, and the CIOMS International Ethical Guidelines for Biomedical Research Involving Human Subjects.

column8: The role of real-world evidence in driving vaccine value and access
column13: As a company on the front line of influenza prevention, CSL Seqirus is committed to using RWE to continually evaluate the clinical benefit and cost-effectiveness of our innovative seasonal influenza vaccines compared to more traditional options. RWE can be a valuable tool in helping health agencies decide which influenza vaccines to recommend for specific populations, providing access to the most vulnerable groups through government-funded immunization programs.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column8: CSL ViforÃ¢ÂÂs commitment to patients through the Patient Academy
column13: The CSL Vifor Patient Academy offers employees the unique opportunity to learn directly from patient representatives about the disease burden they carry and the importance of involving patients' insights in critical strategic decisions, from clinical development programs to the development of patient support programs. When engaging directly with patients, we follow strict engagement protocols and apply standardized remuneration principles.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: As one of the world's largest producers of plasma-derived therapies and a leader in plasma collection, CSL Plasma commits to excellence and innovation across the entire cycle of plasma donation, from donor screening throughout the donation process and across plasma testing and logistics. About 15,000 CSL Plasma employees ensure safety. Quality plasma can be manufactured into life-saving therapies.

New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: Supply chain legislation training refers to educational programs and initiatives to inform individuals, particularly those involved in supply chain management, procurement, and related fields, about relevant laws, regulations, and compliance requirements governing supply chain practices. This training ensures that professionals understand their legal obligations, mitigate risks, and adhere to ethical standards in managing supply chain operations.

column6: Negative social impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
column7: Anyone with information about potential misconduct is encouraged to 'Speak Up' under the CSL Speak Up Policy. It includes CSL's current and past employees, directors, contractors, customers, suppliers and associates. All reports made under this policy are received, treated sensitively and thoughtfully, and dealt with promptly, fairly, and objectively.

column6: Political contributions
column7: Over the reporting period, CSL contributed a total of US$1,000 in non-cash corporate political contributions in the United States and A$5,500 to political organisations in Australia solely for attendance at events, including policy briefings, lunches, boardroom lunches and dinners. In all other regions, CSL made no political contributions.

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column7: In 2022/23, CSL's quality systems, plasma collection and manufacturing operations were subject to 473 regulatory agency inspections worldwide. Of these, 21 good manufacturing practice (GMP) regulatory agency inspections occurred at our manufacturing facilities, and 452 regulatory inspections occurred at our plasma collection centres.

column7: This year, there were 11 counterfeit products reported to and confirmed by CSL Behring. CSL Behring is evaluating opportunities to increase the security of packaging solutions to prevent counterfeiting.

column13: CSL recognizes the escalating risk of cyber threats and data privacy breaches targeting individuals and organizations. CSL maintains a proactive stance by continuously monitoring and assessing cybersecurity threats.

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Breaches of CSL information technology (IT) security and unauthorized or inadvertent release of information caused by human error, malware or espionage may compromise the privacy and security of our data. CSL has designed and implemented robust security controls for its IT systems, infrastructure, and data based on understanding known threats, industry best practices, and external testing to ensure their effectiveness.

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Furthermore, CSL understand that awareness and preparedness are key in responding to cyberattacks and safeguarding data privacy. As such, CSL places great emphasis on providing ongoing education and training to their employees.
